question.prompt: According to the text, why would an artificial language like Esperanto be considered boring by many learners?

options.label: It has a very complex grammar.
It would be thought boring by many learners because it has no culture.
It is too difficult to learn for most people.
It lacks native speakers.

hint: Câu hỏi về lý do ngôn ngữ nhân tạo bị coi là nhàm chán. Tìm thông tin trong đoạn văn về Esperanto.

question.prompt: What is frequently stated about English regarding its status as a global language?

options.label: English is often said to be quickly becoming a world language.
English is rarely spoken outside of its native countries.
English is considered too difficult for international communication.
English is losing its popularity as a second language.

hint: Tìm cụm từ trong đoạn văn nói về điều người ta thường nói về tiếng Anh.

question.prompt: How is English described in terms of its global usage?

options.label: It is the least used language in the world.
It is certainly the most widely used language in the world.
It is only used in English-speaking countries.
It is primarily used for scientific research.

hint: Đoạn văn đề cập đến mức độ sử dụng của tiếng Anh trên toàn cầu.

question.prompt: For what reasons is English not universally accepted as a world language?

options.label: It is too difficult to learn for non-native speakers.
For political reasons and national pride, English is not acceptable to everyone.
Its vocabulary is too limited for complex ideas.
It has too many dialects.

hint: Tìm lý do tiếng Anh không được chấp nhận rộng rãi trong đoạn văn.

question.prompt: What new word has been created in France to describe the impact of English on their language?

options.label: A new word, "Anglais," has been invented.
A new word, "Franglais," has been invented.
A new word, "Globish," has been invented.
A new word, "Euroglish," has been invented.

hint: Đoạn văn nhắc đến một từ mới được tạo ra ở Pháp.

question.prompt: What is currently happening with English education in schools abroad?

options.label: English is being taught in fewer and fewer schools abroad.
English is being taught in more and more schools abroad.
English is being replaced by other languages in schools abroad.
English is no longer a compulsory subject in schools abroad.

hint: Tìm thông tin về việc giảng dạy tiếng Anh ở các trường học nước ngoài.

question.prompt: What is a significant challenge when choosing a living language as a common international language?

options.label: A living language will be too difficult to standardize.
No living language will be acceptable to everyone.
A living language will change too quickly.
A living language will not have enough resources for learning.

hint: Đoạn văn nói về vấn đề khi chọn một ngôn ngữ sống làm ngôn ngữ chung.

question.prompt: What are the two main approaches suggested to solve the language problem?

options.label: One of the main living languages can be chosen, or an artificial one can be made up.
All countries must learn English, or learn Chinese.
People should only use their native language, or use sign language.
Governments should invest in translation technology, or hire more interpreters.

hint: Đoạn văn đưa ra hai giải pháp khả thi cho vấn đề ngôn ngữ.

question.prompt: What is often threatened when English words enter other languages?

options.label: The global economy is often threatened.
The cultural identity of nations is often threatened.
Their own language is often threatened.
International relations are often threatened.

hint: Tìm thông tin về mối đe dọa khi từ tiếng Anh xâm nhập vào các ngôn ngữ khác.

question.prompt: What is the attitude of not every nation towards the leading position of English in their education system?

options.label: It is enthusiastically embraced by every nation.
It is not always popular, and not every nation is prepared to accept it.
It is seen as a minor issue by most nations.
It is considered a temporary trend.

hint: Đoạn văn nói về sự chấp nhận vị trí dẫn đầu của tiếng Anh trong hệ thống giáo dục.
